Subjective: Headache for ~2 months; worsening frequency, now almost weekly. Location: primarily Right side, but can be diffuse. Duration: simmers for a few days. Associated with nausea (at worst), visual glare, photophobia (prefers dark room), and phonophobia (talking worsens). Pertinent negatives: No vomiting, no flashes of light. No clear stress trigger. Treatments tried: Paracetamol and Ibuprofen with some relief. Impact: Unable to play volleyball or socialize with friends. Family Hx: Father with migraines, grandfather with cluster headaches; no family hx of tumors. Social: 20 y/o student. No smoking, drugs, coffee, or energy drinks. Occasional alcohol (2-3 beers/occasion). Exercises regularly. Request: Wants diagnosis (migraine vs. cluster headache?) and treatment plan.
Objective: Vitals: BP 120/80, Pulse 50/min (steady). Neuro Exam: Cranial nerves intact. Finger-to-nose test good. Arm and leg strength good. Romberg's normal. Gait: slightly off when walking a straight line.
Assessment: Suspected Migraine. Cluster headache less likely.
Plan: 1. Patient education: Read about migraine on thuisarts.nl. 2. Medications: At symptom onset, start pain relief immediately. First-line Paracetamol; may add Ibuprofen if needed. 3. Monitoring: Keep a headache diary to identify patterns and triggers. 4. Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks with diary to evaluate. 5. Safety Netting: Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
